djinn-board/agent.title: Agent
djinn-board/agent.description: This is a module that will handled the communication with the cloud, it talks with the cloud via gRPC, which uses proto buffers underneath.

djinn-board/authentication-server.title: Authentication Server
djinn-board/authentication-server.description: This is a OAuth 2.0 server, build in go, that handles the authentication of the users that wan't to control the board.

djinn-board/event-bus.title: Event Bus
djinn-board/event-bus.description: In the application all the comunication is going to be asynchrounous and is going to use an message queue to handle the request, the reason we are doing this is because is easy to scale the application using the asynchrounous nature of a publish-subscribe system.

djinn-board/gateway.title: Gateway
djinn-board/gateway.description: This is a service that is going to offer a graphql API to interact with the application from the outside world, is going to run in the port 5555 and applications can be built on top of the graphql.

djinn-board/overview.title: Overview
djinn-board/overview.description: This is the architecture for the application that is going to run inside the board,

djinn-board/persistance-layer.title: Persistance Layer
djinn-board/persistance-layer.description: This is the layer that is used to keep a persistant state of the system, is accesed by the Authentication Service, the Gateway and the platform.

djinn-board/platform.title: Platform
djinn-board/platform.description: This part of the architecture is going to handle the communication between the

djinn-board/web-client.title: Web Client
djinn-board/web-client.description: This is a web interface that is build in react and runs on top of the Djinn Gateway, it runs on port 80 and enables the users to configure and control the Djinn OS from a browser.

djinn-cloud/overview.title: Overview
djinn-cloud/overview.description: Djinn is going to use the Open-core business model, which is the same that is used by:

intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: Let's discover Docusaurus in less than 5 minutes.

tutorial-basics/congratulations.title: Congratulations!
tutorial-basics/congratulations.description: You have just learned the basics of Docusaurus and made some changes to the initial template.

tutorial-basics/create-a-blog-post.title: Create a Blog Post
tutorial-basics/create-a-blog-post.description: Docusaurus creates a page for each blog post, but also a blog index page, a tag system, an RSS feed...

tutorial-basics/create-a-document.title: Create a Document
tutorial-basics/create-a-document.description: Documents are groups of pages connected through:

tutorial-basics/create-a-page.title: Create a Page
tutorial-basics/create-a-page.description: Add Markdown or React files to src/pages to create a standalone page:

tutorial-basics/deploy-your-site.title: Deploy your site
tutorial-basics/deploy-your-site.description: Docusaurus is a static-site-generator (also called Jamstack).

tutorial-basics/markdown-features.title: Markdown Features
tutorial-basics/markdown-features.description: Docusaurus supports Markdown and a few additional features.

tutorial-extras/manage-docs-versions.title: Manage Docs Versions
tutorial-extras/manage-docs-versions.description: Docusaurus can manage multiple versions of your docs.
